[中国] 河北 教育 出版 社 [加拿大] DC加拿大国际交流中心合作编写 ENGLISH 义务教育教科书英语六年级上册 （三年级起点） 
亲爱的同学们，欢迎你们进入六年级！ 这学期你们将了解加拿大的生活习惯、学校生活、季节特点以及重要的节日。 李明为了学习英语去加拿大上学了！你们想知道加拿大的学校和我们的学校有什么不同吗？ 你们想知道李明和好朋友丹尼、詹妮在寒冷的冬季会做些什么吗？ 你们一定知道圣诞节。你们知道如何装饰圣诞树吗？你们还想了解更多关于圣诞节的故事吗？那就开始我们这学期的学习吧！ 同学们，这学期你们将继续学习英语名词复数的变化，这些变化有什么规律呢？你们还将学习用英语描述将来要发生的事情，这种语句有什么变化， 有什么规律可循呢？在学习中，你们要注意发现语言的规律并能运用规律举一反三。这样，学习英语就非常容易了！ 同学们，你们要多参与英语学习活动，注意反思自己学习过程中的进步与不足，经常与老师和同学交流学习体会，探索适合自己的英语学习方法。 相信你们一定能学得很棒！ 致同 学

content: 37 UNIT 3 Lessons 13～18 Winter in Canada 38 Lesson 13 Seasons 1 Winter, spring, summer and autumn Winter, spring, summer and autumn are seasons. There are four seasons in a year. This is autumn. Autumn is cool. The leaves turn red and yellow. 2 Different clothes for different seasons In winter, I put on my hat, scarf and winter coat. In spring, I take off my winter clothes. I have my umbrella. I like the rain. This is winter. Winter is cold. There is ice and snow. This is spring. Spring is warm and rainy. There are new leaves and flowers. This is summer. The summer sun is hot. What a hot, sunny day!

content: 44 Lesson 16 A Skating Lesson 1 Can you skate? Danny is going to teach Li Ming to skate. But Danny is late. “Look! There’s Danny!” says Jenny. “Sorry, I’m late,” says Danny. “That’s okay,” say Jenny and Li Ming. “I’m going to teach you to skate, Li Ming,” says Danny. I fell down again! Oops! “Can you skate?” asks Danny. “I think I can,” says Li Ming. “Come on, Danny!” “Oops!” says Danny. He falls down. Li Ming skates over to Danny. “How did I do, Danny?” he asks. “You learn fast, Li Ming!” says Danny. “Oops!” says Danny. He falls down again. “Can you stand up?” asks Jenny. “No, I can’t,” says Danny. “Can you stand up on the ice?” asks Danny. “Yes, I can,” says Li Ming. “Look, Danny! I’m standing!” “Good!” says Danny. Danny stands up, too.

At Christmas, we have Christmas trees, lights and Santa. Christmas lights Christmas tree This is a Christmas tree. It’s so beautiful! These are Christmas lights on our house. This is Santa. Who is he? He is a merry man in red clothes. Children say he brings gifts on Christmas. We invite our family and friends to our house. They bring gifts for us. Please come for Christmas! 1 What's Christmas? Hello! Merry Christmas! Merry Christmas! Grandpa! Grandma!

content: 64 Lesson 1:How Are You? Lesson 23 It’s Christmas Morning! 1 Open our gifts 1 2 3 “Who brought these gifts, Jenny?” Li Ming asks. “Did Santa bring them?” “I don’t think so. I think Mum and Dad brought them, but Lynn is little! She thinks Santa brought them!” Jenny says to Li Ming. Lynn sees a gift. It has her name on it! She opens it. “Look! Santa brought me toys!” she says. “Look, Li Ming! You have a gift, too. It’s from Santa!” Lynn gives Li Ming the gift. “Open it, Li Ming!” “Oh! It’s a camera!” says Li Ming. “I wanted a camera! Now I can take pictures and send them to my mother and father!” Then Li Ming gives his gift to Mr. and Mrs. Smith. It’s Christmas morning! This morning we open our gifts! Did Santa bring gifts? content: 67 ★ Retell the story I think Santa was afraid of me. 6 8 10 Today we are getting ready for Christmas. We put lights on our house. Now we are putting up our Christmas tree. We put a star on the tree. Then my mother and father put gifts under the tree. My brother and sister put gifts under the tree, too. I don’t have a gift! Oh, no! I go to my bedroom. I work and work. Then I put a card on our Christmas tree. On Christmas morning, my family opens my gift. It’s a song! Everyone sings my song. Here it is. Yikes! There! 7 9 Wow! Great! Thank you, Maddy! At Christmas we give gifts. I have a gift for you. It’s something very special. But it isn’t something new. I didn’t buy a thing for you. The things were all too small. My gift is that I love you. content: 71 7 Read and write. What are the same ? What are different ? The Spring Festival Dear Wang Hong, Christmas is coming in Canada. It’s on December 25. It’s a fun holiday. We buy a Christmas tree and put it up in our house. Then we put gifts under the tree. Also, we visit our family and friends. We give them gifts. We eat good food and sing Christmas songs together. What is the Spring Festival like in China? Your friend, Jack Christmas Dear Jack, How nice to get your email! The Spring Festival is coming in February this year. It’s also a fun holiday. In January, we get ready for the Festival. We clean the house and buy new clothes. On the day of the Festival, we also visit our family and friends. We make dumplings together. And kids get lucky money. That’s the Chinese Spring Festival. You can come to China one day and stay with us for the Spring Festival. Yours truly, Wang Hong

It snows too much! “I have to wear my big coat,” says Little Billy. No! I don’t like autumn at all! No! I don’t like winter at all! 82 An old farmer hears the children talking. “What did you have for breakfast ? Did you have vegetables ? ” “Yes, we had some vegetables. This afternoon we will have some fruit.” “In spring, farmers plant vegetables and fruit. The rain falls and the young plants begin to grow,” says the old farmer. “In summer the sun is hot. It makes the plants grow big and strong.” The children listen. This is a very interesting lesson. “Next comes autumn. The plants are strong and healthy. The farmers bring them home and make delicious food. The food makes people grow strong and healthy,” the old farmer says.

content: 83 The children want to know about winter. The old farmer looks at the children. “Do you sleep at night ? ” he asks. “Yes, we sleep at night. We have a good rest,” say the four children. “In winter, the land is tired. It needs a good rest, too,” says the old farmer. “It needs to sleep.” “So, say thanks to spring, summer, autumn and winter,” says the old farmer. That is why we need the four seasons. wet 潮湿的 begin 开始 rest 睡眠或休息（的时间） land 田地；耕地 What about winter? Spring, summer, autumn and winter — we love all of you!

content: 84 It was morning. Li Ming felt sad. Today was New Year’s Day in China, but not in Canada. On the last New Year’s Day, in China, Li Ming got new clothes. He got new shoes, new socks, a new shirt and new trousers. Li Ming liked Canada, but he wanted new clothes for New Year’s Day. New Clothes for Li Ming In China, everyone visited their family. Li Ming and his parents always visited Li Ming’s grandparents. Li Ming liked Canada, but he wanted to visit his family on New Year’s Day.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5.pdf

content: 85 Li Ming put on his clothes and went to the kitchen. Jenny was sitting at the table. She was having breakfast. But Li Ming didn’t feel fine. He felt sad. He liked Canada, but today he wanted to be in China. Li Ming went to school with Danny and Jenny. He talked to Mr. Wood, but he didn’t smile. He looked at the floor. Mr. Wood said to the class, “Today is a special day. We are going to do some special things. First we are going to clean the classroom. Then we are going to make dumplings.” “Clean the classroom ? Make dumplings ? Why ? ” asked everyone. Good morning, Li Ming! Good morning. Good morning, Li Ming! How are you today? Fine, thanks.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5.pdf

content: 86 Li Ming helped the class make dumplings. Then they cooked the dumplings. They ate the dumplings with chopsticks. “Happy New Year, Li Ming!” everyone said. “Happy New Year!” Li Ming laughed. “Do you know why, Li Ming ? ” asked Mr. Wood. Now Li Ming felt happy. “Sure!” he said. “It’s Chinese New Year’s Day!” Everyone helped clean the classroom. Mr. Wood had pictures for the twelve Chinese years. “Li Ming,” he said. “Please help me. What is the first ? ” “The rat is the first,” said Li Ming. “Then come the ox, tiger, rabbit, dragon, snake, horse, sheep, monkey, rooster, dog and pig.” Oops! These are good! Can we do this next year, too?

content: 87 Li Ming, Danny and Jenny went home. “Hello!” said Mr. Smith. “How was school today ? ” “It was fun!” said Jenny and Danny. “It was great!” said Li Ming. “There’s a box from China for you, Li Ming,” said Mr. Smith. “Here.” Li Ming quickly opened the box. Inside he found new shoes, new red socks, a new red shirt and new red trousers! There was a card, too. grandparents （外）祖父祖母 chopstick 筷子 88 The Story of Santa It’s the day before Christmas. Li Ming, Jenny and Danny put up the Christmas tree. They put a yellow star on the tree and the gifts under it. They are happy. Tomorrow is Christmas Day. Li Ming is excited. This is his first Christmas in Canada. He wants to know more about this holiday. Why does Santa give gifts to children? That’s an old, old story. Let’s read about it in the book.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（三年级起点）六年级上册_a16d51f5.pdf

content: 89 Long ago, there really was a Santa, but his name was Saint Nicholas. There are many stories about him. He helped children and gave gifts to poor people. In North America, his name changed. People began to call him Santa. Santa is old and has white hair. Kids believe that Santa brings them gifts on Christmas. Saint Nicholas was really a good man. Yes. Everyone loved him. His name was famous. Santa always says, “Ho! Ho! Ho!” Right? Yes, he is a merry man. 90 Santa lives in the North Pole. On Christmas Eve, Santa rides in a sleigh. His reindeer pull the sleigh and they fly in the sky. Santa comes into the house through the chimney. Li Ming likes the story about Santa. How does Santa deliver the gifts to children? Let’s go on reading.

content: 91 Jenny says, “When I was a little kid, I often put a stocking out for Santa to put gifts in. On Christmas morning, I would look in my stocking to find my gifts.” Danny says, “I did that, too. My favourite gift is donuts.” “Wow, I will put a stocking beside the tree this evening,” says Li Ming. “Jenny, what else do you know about Christmas ? Please tell me more about it.” Li Ming asks. “OK. Red, green and white are Christmas colours,” answers Jenny. “Santa’s hat is white and red and he wears red and white clothes. Our Christmas tree is green,” says Danny. I love Christmas! I hope tomorrow will come soon. I know! Santa puts gifts in the children’s stockings beside the tree.
